intro: Mentzelia hirsutissima var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Mentzelia hirsutissima var. stenophylla is part of the Loasaceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
